p: In contrast to HA and NA, the internal influenza virus proteins are relatively well conserved and display limited antigenic diversity (Bui et al. 2007). A number of vaccine candidates have been developed to induce T cell responses, by intracellularly expressing NP and M1 using replication deficient viral vectors like Chimpanzee Adenovirus Oxford 1 (ChAdOx1) or Modified Vaccinia Ankara (MVA) (Berthoud et al. 2011; Lillie et al. 2012; Lambe et al. 2013; Antrobus et al. 2014a, b).
